scope.goal: Develop a high-converting landing page for TaskMaster, a task management platform, to highlight key features like task organization, collaboration, and productivity tools. It addresses the pain point of potential users abandoning sites due to unclear messaging and unengaging design by providing intuitive navigation, compelling visuals, and seamless sign-up flows to boost conversions.

tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14+ App Router + TS + Tailwind + Shadcn

features: Hero section with value proposition, demo video, and primary CTA for sign-up
Features showcase using cards to detail task creation, team collaboration, and integrations
Testimonials slider with user quotes and logos
Pricing teaser or waitlist form integrated with Clerk for email capture
Footer with links, social proof, and contact info
SEO-optimized with meta tags, fast loading via Next.js Image and SSG
comps: Trello (strong visual boards but lacks deep productivity insights; gap in mobile-first design)
Asana (comprehensive feature lists but overwhelming for new users; gap in quick onboarding CTAs)
Todoist (simple and clean but minimal customization; gap in team collaboration highlights)
scope.outcome: Live demo on localhost:3000 + Vercel deployment URL + 80% test coverage with Jest

in_scope: Integration of Clerk for sign-up form
milestones: M1: Research competitors and wireframes complete (1h)
M2: Design specs and component selection from database (1h)
risks: Component availability in database (mitigate by querying UI DB first)
Clerk integration delays (mitigate with pre-built auth flows)
